text:
Remember that big feature I got excited about months ago, but was never able to announce and release?

It’s coming… brace your selves and be patient for just a little longer, we think we have everything we need now to finish it
clippy gets married?
ernest goes  to camp catchphrases?
that is what i have been missing

All I’m gonna say right now is if you haven’t installed the beta version of the extension. I think you’re going to want to do it soon, because this update will hit the beta channel first for sure. I will announce it in the slack channel when I release it.
FIREFOX SUPPORT!!!
thank you!
you are the best
sorry to dissapoint, no firefox support yet
you dont need to say anything else
damn
too slow typing
_that's a direct kick in my direction technically..._
haha both of you want firefox support, I’ve told both of you, there’s a github issue with a link to the docs on how to make it happen. If you want it, you can make it happen.
i just like to whine
I'm definitely going to do it...and not whining about it [like some people]...I'm just slow which is a thing
:stuck_out_tongue:
and i will be right behind you <@U26D0TF8E> to take credit when you finish
will add an extra line of code at the end
:wink:
`/*Dennis was here*/`
yep
sounds about right :stuck_out_tongue:
sadly... :disappointed:
they called him the stealer of thunder
I think we should call you the Hero of Canton

>>>~Jayne~ Dennis!
The man they call ~Jayne~ Dennis!
He robbed from the rich and he gave to the poor.
Stood up to the man and he gave him what for.
Our love for him now, ain't hard to explain,
The hero of Canton, the man they call ~Jayne~ Dennis!

For those interested in setting up the beta version of the extension <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/How-to-use-the-Beta-version-of-the-extension>

The feature is not live in there yet but you will get it when released.
i always wanted a song :cry:

*BETA USERS OF THE EXTENSION*
I have rolled out a new feature to you, you may need to go to <chrome://extensions> and re-enable the extension due to a permissions change.
<https://spin.d.pr/e8w4Zz+>

Full write up on the new feature and explanation of this permission. *You’re gonna love it.*
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/releases/tag/v1.05.01-beta>

granting the permission does not have any affect on the stable version of the extension. Also we hope to make this permission completely optional for users of the extension long term. First though we wanted to get it out to all of you.

Screenshots of the new feature:
<https://spin.d.pr/yqsn1d+>
<https://spin.d.pr/Wf3Fn6+>

In-case it’s not immediately obvious. In the inspector there is now a HubSpot tab. This tab displays the developer info for the current page. The key value pairs are clickable. Clicking a key will copy to your clipboard the HubL to get that specific data. Clicking the value will copy just the value.

Huge huge thanks to <@U7ADCU3BM>, he did 99% of the css and JS for formatting the JSON and generating the HubL, <@U6GNQ7JBU> <@U6W3H6YN8> consulted on js to get the developer info in a secure way.(no data is stored in the extension at all, no data leaves the extension to make the dev info feature work, a user can only view developer info if they have permission through the sprocket button normally). This feature is expected to break due to an API change, so enjoy it while it lasts, I hope to upgrade the feature to make it continue working but likely have to rely on collaboration with HubSpot in order to do so.
